content.description: This route follows the rappel line from the top of the formation. It's a moderately interesting TR to add a little climbing after having climbed the Regular Route. Could be described as mostly delicate low angle face climbing.
content.protection: Bolts and chains at the top for the 80' rappel back to the base.

content.description:
Do not traverse left across the steep, unprotected 5.10a face to the base of the crack (if you do you're climbing Mousetrap). Instead, climb the first 15' of Regular Route, traverse left across a horizontal crack to the vertical crack, and climb the vertical crack or the face right of the crack between two bushes and to the right of another bush to the top.

The crack can also be climbed directly from the bottom without the traverse.
content.protection: A set of cams and a few slings if you wish to sling the bushes. There is a bolt beneath the summit.
content.location: This is the wide vertical crack left of the Regular Route.

climbs.name: Regular Route
climbs.fa: Tom Rixon, Jack Arnold, Fred Kelly 11/1940

content.description: 3rd class to a gully leads you to the base of the route: an easy maybe 5.4 chimney. Exit left to some face/crack climbing that tops out on an exposed ridge. Traverse left to another section of face/OW crack climbing. Top out to the left. The hardest move is transitioning into the final section of crack without pulling too hard on the every questionable Pinnacle's rock. Bolts and chains at the top for the 80' rappel back to the base.
content.protection: Two bolts (one before the traverse and one before the final moves). We placed a BD .75 in the thinner first crack and BD 1 right before the second crack.
content.location: On the east face of Elephant Rock.

climbs.name: Dumbo
climbs.fa: Brooks White and J. Fleckenstein, Jan 2000

content.description: This short, 15' face climb provides an approach pitch to Elephant Rock, transforming it into a multipitch adventure. The rock quality is subpar, a small handhold broke the last time I climbed it.
content.location: Follow a trail up and around the rock formation southeast of Elephant Rock to a high point and search for a single bolt on the short wall on the left. Climb past a bolt to a 3-bolt anchor. If continuing to Elephant Rock, traverse 50' across the broad ridge to the base of Elephant Rock, passing a bolt along the way, and set up a belay anchor at the base of Regular Route.
